app.title: Sexual Repression Index Calculator
app.description: Professional Sexual Mental Health Assessment Tool Based on Scientific Research

home.welcome: Welcome to Sexual Repression Index Calculator
home.subtitle: A professional assessment tool based on multiple validated psychological scales

features.scientific: Scientific and Reliable: Based on internationally recognized scales including SIS/SES, Mosher Sexual Guilt, KISS-9, and SOS

adaptiveAssessment.title: Intelligent Adaptive Assessment
adaptiveAssessment.description: The system automatically selects the most suitable scale combination based on your age group and personal background. Special protection mechanisms are provided for adolescents aged 14-17, and culturally sensitive assessment content is provided for users without sexual experience, ensuring that everyone can obtain accurate and appropriate assessment experience.

versionSelection.title: Choose the Assessment Version That Suits You
versionSelection.description: We offer two assessment versions. You can choose according to your available time and level of detail required

quick.title: Quick Assessment Version
quick.subtitle: Suitable for first-time use and quick understanding

full.title: Full Assessment Version
full.subtitle: More comprehensive and in-depth professional analysis

scientificBasis.title: Scientifically Reliable Assessment Foundation
scientificBasis.description: Based on internationally recognized psychometric scales, rigorously validated scientific tools

sis.title: Dual Control Model
sis.description: Based on the SIS/SES dual control model by Janssen et al., measuring sexual inhibition and sexual excitation systems

guilt.title: Sexual Guilt Measurement
guilt.description: Using the Mosher Sexual Guilt Scale to assess sexual-related guilt and moral burden

shame.title: Sexual Shame Assessment
shame.description: Using the KISS-9 scale to measure sexual-related shame experiences and self-acceptance

sos.title: Sexual Opinion Survey
sos.description: The SOS scale assesses emotional orientation and approach-avoidance tendencies toward sexual stimuli

privacy.title: Your Privacy Is Our Primary Concern
privacy.description: All assessment data is processed and stored locally on your device only, and will not be uploaded to any server. You have complete data control and can delete or export your assessment history at any time.

cta.title: Ready to Start Your Sexual Mental Health Journey?
cta.description: Through scientific self-assessment, better understand yourself and promote healthy sexual psychological development and intimate relationships.

footer.description: A sexual repression index calculator based on scientific research to help you better understand your sexual mental health.
footer.copyright: For educational and self-understanding purposes only, cannot replace professional mental health services.

nonProfitModal.title: Important Statement
nonProfitModal.description: This project is open source and free, designed to provide educational and self-understanding sexual mental health assessment tools.
nonProfitModal.warning: If you paid for this link, please request a refund/report immediately⚠️
nonProfitModal.benefit1: All services provided completely free of charge
nonProfitModal.benefit2: No commercial sponsorship of any form accepted
nonProfitModal.benefit3: Data used only for personal educational purposes
nonProfitModal.footer: This website is only an auxiliary tool for mental health education. All assessment results are for reference only and cannot replace professional mental health diagnosis and treatment.
nonProfitModal.confirm: I understand and agree to continue using

consent.title: Informed Consent
consent.description: Please read the following carefully before starting the assessment
consent.consentText: I understand that this is a psychological measurement tool for self-understanding. The results are for reference only and cannot replace professional mental health services. I voluntarily agree to participate in this assessment and understand that all my data will be stored only in the local browser and will not be uploaded to any server.

results.title: Assessment Results
results.scoreExplanation: Your SRI index is {{score}}, at the {{level}} level

solutions.title: Possible Solutions
solutions.1: Ensure you correctly clicked "View Results" from the history page
solutions.2: Check if the assessment record was accidentally deleted
solutions.4: If the problem persists, please retake the assessment

disclaimer.title: Important Reminder
disclaimer.description: This tool is for reference only and cannot replace professional mental health diagnosis. If you have serious concerns, please seek help from a professional psychological counselor promptly.

shared.interpretation: This is a shared assessment result.
shared.recommendations: If you want to get a personalized detailed analysis, please start your own assessment.

history.title: History Records
history.subtitle: View and manage your assessment records

empty.title: No Assessment Records
empty.description: You haven't completed any assessments yet. Start your first Sexual Repression Index assessment to explore deeper self-awareness.

confirmClear.title: Confirm Clear All Records
confirmClear.description: This operation will permanently delete all assessment history records and cannot be recovered. Are you sure you want to continue?

confirmDelete.title: Confirm Delete Record
confirmDelete.description: This operation will permanently delete this assessment record and cannot be recovered. Are you sure you want to continue?

science.title: Scientific Basis
science.description: Sexual Repression Index Assessment System Based on Rigorous Psychological Research and Classic Scales

dualControl.title: Dual Control Model
dualControl.description: The dual control model of sexual response proposed by Janssen et al. (2002) suggests that human sexual response is regulated by dual systems: the Sexual Excitation System (SES) and the Sexual Inhibition System (SIS). This model provides an important theoretical framework for understanding individual differences in sexual behavior.

repression.title: Concept of Sexual Repression
repression.description: Sexual repression refers to the systematic inhibition of sexual impulses, desires, and behaviors by individuals, usually stemming from the combined influence of psychological, socio-cultural, and moral factors. Modern psychological research shows that moderate sexual inhibition is normal, but excessive repression may affect mental health.

sis.name: SIS/SES-SF
sis.fullName: Sexual Inhibition/Sexual Excitation Scale Short Form
sis.author: Janssen et al. (2002)
sis.description: Measures the sensitivity of sexual inhibition and sexual excitation systems, including two dimensions: performance-related inhibition (SIS1) and threat/fear-related inhibition (SIS2).

mosher.name: Mosher Sexual Guilt Scale
mosher.author: Mosher (1988)
mosher.description: Assesses the degree of guilt individuals feel toward sexual behaviors and thoughts, reflecting the core characteristics of moralized sexual repression.

kiss.name: KISS-9 Sexual Shame Scale
kiss.author: Kyle et al. (2013)
kiss.description: Measures individuals' shame experiences related to sexual identity, sexual thoughts, and sexual behaviors, capturing deep sexual self-concept issues.

sos.name: SOS Sexual Opinion Scale
sos.author: Fisher et al. (1988)
sos.description: Assesses individuals' emotional orientation toward sexual stimuli and related content, measuring sexual openness versus conservatism.

dimensions.title: Four-Dimensional Standardization
dimensions.sosDesc: SOS score reversed conversion, high score indicates negative reaction to sexual stimuli
dimensions.guiltDesc: Mosher scale raw score, reflecting moralized sexual repression
dimensions.shameDesc: KISS-9 score, measuring sexual identity shame experience
dimensions.inhibitionDesc: (SIS1+SIS2-SES) difference, reflecting the advantage of inhibition over excitation

zscore.title: Z-Score Standardization
zscore.description: Convert raw scores of each dimension to z-scores to eliminate dimensional differences and facilitate integrated analysis.

mapping.title: 0-100 Mapping
mapping.description: Linearly map the standardized comprehensive score to the 0-100 range to form an easily understandable SRI index.

reliability.title: Reliability
reliability.item1: Internal consistency reliability (Cronbach's α) is above 0.85

validity.title: Validity
validity.item1: Content validity confirmed by expert review
validity.item2: Structural validity supported by confirmatory factor analysis
validity.item3: Criterion validity shows significant correlation with clinical diagnosis

recommendations.title: Usage Recommendations
recommendations.description: This tool aims to provide scientific self-assessment reference. Result interpretation should be combined with personal actual circumstances

education.title: Educational Application
education.description: Suitable for sex education courses and mental health promotion, helping students establish correct sexual concepts

self.title: Self-Exploration
self.description: Provides a tool for individuals to reflect on their sexual psychological state, promoting self-awareness and growth

therapy.title: Counseling Support
therapy.description: Can be used as an initial assessment tool for counselors to understand clients' sexual psychological status

research.title: Research Reference
research.description: Provides data support and theoretical validation basis for sexual psychology research

guide.title: User Guide
guide.description: Learn in detail how to properly use the Sexual Repression Index (SRI) assessment tool to obtain accurate and reliable evaluation results

consent.title: Informed Consent
consent.description: Read and agree to the terms of participation in the assessment

demographics.title: Basic Information
demographics.description: Fill in necessary demographic information (completely anonymous)

questionnaire.title: Questionnaire Completion
questionnaire.description: Answer questions honestly according to your actual situation

results.title: View Results
results.description: Obtain detailed SRI index analysis report

honest.title: Honest Answers
honest.description: Please answer according to your true thoughts and feelings. There is no standard answer

intuition.title: Intuitive Response
intuition.description: Trust your first intuition, don't overthink each question

completion.title: Complete Answers
completion.description: Try to complete all questions. Skipping too many will affect result accuracy

privacy.title: Privacy Environment
privacy.description: Complete the assessment in a private, undisturbed environment

interpretation.title: Result Interpretation
interpretation.description: The SRI index uses a 0-100 scoring system. The higher the score, the more severe the sexual repression

levels.veryLow: Very low level of sexual repression, good sexual mental health
levels.low: Low level of sexual repression, better sexual mental health
levels.medium: Moderate level of sexual repression, recommend paying attention to sexual mental health
levels.high: High level of sexual repression, recommend seeking professional help
levels.veryHigh: Very high level of sexual repression, strongly recommend seeking professional help

warning.title: Important Reminder
warning.description: This tool is for reference only and cannot replace professional mental health diagnosis. If you have serious concerns, please seek help from a professional psychological counselor promptly.

privacy.title: Privacy Protection
privacy.description: We highly value your privacy protection and adopt industry-leading privacy protection measures

local.title: Local Processing
local.description: All data is processed locally on your device only and will not be uploaded to any server

anonymous.title: Completely Anonymous
anonymous.description: No personal identity information is collected. Data is completely anonymized

control.title: Data Control
control.description: You have complete data control and can view, export, or delete data at any time

deletion.title: Secure Deletion
deletion.description: Provides one-click deletion function to ensure complete data removal

q1.question: Are the assessment results accurate?
q1.answer: This tool is based on internationally authoritative psychometric scales with good reliability and validity. However, the assessment results are for self-understanding reference only and cannot replace professional diagnosis.

q2.question: Is the data secure?
q2.answer: All data is stored locally on your device and will not be uploaded to any server. We do not collect any personal identity information.

q3.question: Can I take the assessment multiple times?
q3.answer: Of course. It is recommended to take the assessment at different time periods to observe changes in sexual psychological state trends.

q4.question: Can results be shared?
q4.answer: Sharing links or QR codes can be generated, but the shared data is encrypted to protect your privacy.
